Chatrium Residence Sathorn Bangkok

The Chatrium Residence Sathorn offers both luxury studio and suite accommodations that are ideal for travelers that want more than just a hotel room. We treated ourselves to a three-bedroom deluxe suite that is literally as big as our two-story townhouse in Chiang Mai. The spacious layout had us and our three family members, who were visiting Bangkok for the first time, feeling comfortable and at home. It also offered retreat from the lively city while still being positioned as an excellent access point to some of the more popular areas of Bangkok.

We had a great first impression of the Chatrium Residence Sathorn. An expansive lobby area greeted us and then we were guided to our sky-high suite and made sure everything was set up well. On our way up to our suite, we passed by the pool and nearby outdoor bar, as well as the on site Albricias Restaurant, which is open for breakfast, lunch, and dinner.

Living and Dining Area

The three-bedroom suite felt like a luxury condo and allowed for plenty of space for the five of us while we enjoyed two nights in Bangkok.

The suite opens up to a large, well decorated living area that has plenty of sitting and dining space. There is a comfortable couch, an ottoman, an extra lounge chair, and a flat-screen TV with English channels. There is also a large dining room table able to accommodate five people and a large balcony overlooking the city skyline.

Bedrooms and Bathrooms

The Chatrium Residence Sathorn’s master bedroom has a comfortable king-sized bed topped with quality linens. It is separate from the other two bedrooms, one of which has two single beds while the other bedroom has one single bed.

All three rooms have wardrobes, a desk area, and night stands. Two rooms also include a large flat screen TV and a telephone. There is no shortage of electrical outlets within the bedrooms.

There are two bathrooms in the three bedroom suite. One is an on-suite bathroom to the master bedroom, which has a separate tub and stand alone rain shower. The second bathroom is shared by the two other bedrooms and also has a tub.

Both bathrooms have Western features, which include large sinks with plenty of counter space and hot and cold water taps. There is also a fan that can be turned on and electrical outlets. The water from the shower comes out very hot and has great pressure.

Fully Equipped Kitchen

The kitchen area has an impressive stock of glasses, wine glasses, coffee cups, plates, and silverware. It also features pans for cooking, a kettle, toaster, coffee maker, and microwave. The double sink has a drying board and there are four electric burners and a full stove. The design of the three-bedroom suite is perfect for long-term staying guests.

For guests wanting to cook, there is a mini-mart about a five minutes walk offering a small selection of fresh produce and items to cook.

This entire three bedroom hotel was less than $25 USD per person per night. Incredible!


International Breakfast Buffet

We all agreed that our favorite part was waking up early to see the city from our balcony and enjoying the amazing breakfast buffet at Albricias, a beautiful restaurant on the fourth floor of the hotel. It was easily one of the best breakfasts in Bangkok we’ve had in a hotel.

The breakfast buffet is incredible. Served from 6:00am to 10:00am, it offers is variety of Western breakfast foods, including pancakes, scrambled eggs, bacon, and sautéed potatoes. There is also a station that created fried or scrambled eggs, or a omelets with several choices for fillings. Pastries and breads are plentiful and accompanied by jam, butter, and cheese. There is also yogurt and muesli, salad, and fresh fruit. The blend of Asian foods included stir fry veggies, noodles, fried and white rice, sushi, rice porridge and miso soup.

The breakfast also includes choices of teas, fresh fruit juices, and coffee, which are available for self-serve. The breakfast has a beautiful presentation, and is clean, hot, and well stocked. This is certainly something to look forward to and a great way to start the morning. Amazingly enough, breakfast for the five of us was included in the price of our suite.

Service

Service is wonderful at the Chatrium Residence Sathorn. We appreciated being guided to our suite since the hotel is composed of several towers. In addition to welcome drinks, we were also provided with extra toiletries for our group of five as we asked for them. Later, our request for extra towels, pillows, and water was also immediately met.

Chatrium Residence Sathorn: Details and Amenities

  • 140 sq m (1,500 sq ft)

  • Master bedroom with on-suite bathroom

  • Two additional bedrooms

  • Desks, TVs, and wardrobes in each bedroom

  • Bath tubs, vent fans, and hot and cold water taps

  • Living room with comfy couch and large dining table

  • Full kitchen

  • Great views of the city from multiple balconies

  • On-site restaurant, outdoor bar, and pool

Suggestions

One area of improvement is the WiFi connection. We had to sign in every half hour or so to maintain a connection and at times it was slow.

Address: 291 Naradhiwas Rajanagarindra 14 Alley, Thung Wat Don
Sathorn, Bangkok 10120, Thailand
Email: [email protected]
Phone: (026) 720-200
Website: Chatrium.com


The beautiful Chatrium Residence Sathorn is located on the south side of the city near the Chao Phraya River in a quiet residential neighborhood. An immediate right exiting the hotel leads to a few good restaurants, as well as a mini-mart. The Central Plaza Rama 3 Shopping Mall is a short ride around the block, and taxi service is available on request through the front desk. The nearest BTS stop is Chong Nonsi about 2.5 km away.
